description: One of the 4d orbitals with a unique lobe structure, often associated with more complex nodal patterns.
orientation: specific to the 4d orbital with m_l = 2, possibly along two orthogonal axes or diagonal

nodes.orientation: specific, based on the complex lobe arrangement
nodes.description: Nodal planes that are uniquely arranged to divide the orbital into multiple lobes, indicative of the complex electron probability distribution in this orbital
Radial nodes indicating regions of zero electron probability at certain distances from the nucleus, characteristic of the 4d orbital's electron distribution
